name: Memory MCP System
observations: Memory system requires explicit user requests to store information
No automatic background tracking or conversation monitoring
Best practice: proactively offer to save important insights and solutions
Memory MCP tools must be called explicitly by user request

name: Coding Standards
observations: CODING STANDARDS: Use arrow functions whenever possible
CODING STANDARDS: Follow StandardJS code standards with React/Next.js exceptions
CODING STANDARDS: No semicolons, two-space indentation, single quotes, strict equality (===)
CODING STANDARDS: CamelCase naming (React components: PascalCase, constants/env: UPPER_CASE)
CODING STANDARDS: Handle err/error parameters, no unused variables, avoid Yoda conditions

name: Universal Patterns
observations: UNIVERSAL JAVASCRIPT PATTERNS: Arrow functions for better 'this' context and readability
UNIVERSAL JAVASCRIPT PATTERNS: StandardJS formatting - no semicolons, two-space indentation, single quotes
UNIVERSAL JAVASCRIPT PATTERNS: Strict equality (===) over loose equality (==) except null checks
UNIVERSAL JAVASCRIPT PATTERNS: Error handling - always handle err/error parameters in function signatures
UNIVERSAL JAVASCRIPT PATTERNS: Clean code - self-documenting names, consistent patterns, no unused variables
UNIVERSAL REACT PATTERNS: React.FC typing for function components, conditional rendering with &&
UNIVERSAL REACT PATTERNS: Array mapping with key props, PascalCase component names, camelCase props
UNIVERSAL COMPONENT CREATION: 1. Define interface 2. Create component file 3. Implement with proper patterns 4. Add to routing/state management
UNIVERSAL FILE STRUCTURE: components/[type]/[ComponentName].tsx, types/[Name].ts, styles/[Name].module.css
UNIVERSAL IMPORT PATTERNS: Relative imports for local, absolute for packages, named imports preferred
UNIVERSAL STATE MANAGEMENT: Local state (useState) > Context API > Redux/Zustand for complex apps
UNIVERSAL ERROR HANDLING: Try-catch for async, error boundaries for React, proper error states in UI
